moves.1. e4: Currently this is my standard white opening
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nd4 4. Nxe5 Qg: I had never seen this opening before and was surprised at how much potential it has if white makes another mistake.
moves.5. Bxf7+ Ke7 6. O-O: This may look like a large mistake, but it beats the alternative of checkmate or loss of close to my entire back rank.
moves.6... Qxe5 7. Bc4: If the queen captures the pawn, I pin it to the king with Rf1
moves.7... Kd8: Moves his king to what seems like a safe spot.
moves.8... Bb4 9. Bd3: securing the pawn  so that capture of knight isn't as damaging
moves.11... Qf6: This is blacks blunder. All I have to do now is make his queen move and I will have mate.
moves.12. Bg5: A decisive move that removes black from the game. Black cannot take the bishop because of the checkmate and can not move the queen because of the pin of his king.
moves.13. Bxf6+: when I take his, it is check
moves.14... Nxd3 15. Qxg7: Forking both the rook and knight with no way to save the knight. All moves result in loss of more material, so black makes the right decision and resigns.
